text:
Graph databases store and 
query connections between data.

For example, social media 
companies use graph databases

for storing more than tens of 
billions of graph connections.

What if you need to perform 
analytics on all of your graph data
to get insights or optimize business decisions?
These analytic tasks use graph analytic algorithms
and require rapid processing of the entire graph
to analyze all of the connections.

Introducing Amazon Neptune Analytics, 
a new analytics database engine
that makes it faster for customers to get insights
and spot trends by quickly analyzing graph data.

With Neptune Analytics, customers 
can analyze a Neptune graph database

or graph data stored in a data lake 
in Amazon S3 with a few clicks.

To quickly analyze graphs with 
10s of billions of connections,

Neptune Analytics stores large 
graph data sets in memory.

Neptune Analytics can serve thousands 
of analytic queries per second

using popular graph analytics 
algorithms for operations

like ranking social influencers, 
detecting groups for fraud,
or finding patterns in network activity.

To help customers get results up to 
80X faster than existing solutions,

Neptune Analytics can load more than tens 
of millions of graph connections per second.

Additionally, Neptune Analytics makes 
it easier and faster to discover data

by storing and searching 
vectors using graph queries.

It eliminates the need to license and manage a 
separate vector database for graph data sets.
Get started today.
